cover up.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to put something over something else so that it cannot be seen
cover up.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Her legs were so swollen she had to cover them up.
cover up.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to prevent people from discovering mistakes or unpleasant facts
cover up.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The affair was covered up and never reached the papers.
Mumâ€™s worried, but she covers it up by joking.
cover up.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to protect someone by hiding unpleasant facts about them
cover up.translation[0].definitions[2].e: They covered up for Kirk by refusing to answer any questions.
cover up.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to put clothes, blankets etc over yourself in order to protect or hide your body, or to keep yourself warm
cover up.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Cover up, or stay out of the sun.
Hastily, she covered herself up with the towel.
cover up.translation[1].definitions[0].d: an attempt to prevent the public from discovering the truth about something
cover up.translation[1].definitions[0].e: He accused the government of a cover-up.
